properties.areaDesc: Central Columbia River Gorge; Central Columbia River Gorge; Upper Hood River Valley
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 17 at 9:39PM PST until January 18 at 2:00PM PST by NWS Portland OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. There may be a brief period of
freezing rain Saturday morning and/or Saturday midday.
Temperatures should warm above freezing Saturday morning near
the river and Saturday afternoon in the upper Hood River valley.
Total snow accumulations of 1 to 6 inches with the heaviest snow
accumulations anticipated to fall above 500-1000 feet. Also,
freezing rain accumulations should generally be very light near
the river, but a tenth of an inch or possibly more may fall in
the upper Hood River valley Saturday morning through midday
Saturday.

* WHERE...Central Columbia River Gorge and the upper Hood River
valley.

* WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 2 PM PST Saturday. The
heaviest snow will likely fall between 2-8 AM Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Avoid unnecessary travel through the Columbia River
Gorge tonight into Saturday morning.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Delay unnecessary travel until later in
the day on Saturday.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM PST SATURDAY
